TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/MdiMinButton extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the **Minimize** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.MdiMinButton class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the **Minimize** button of an MDI child window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.MdiMinButton.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiMinButton1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#375](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_52_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#375](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_52_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Minimize** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Minimize** button of an MDI child window in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiMinButton4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#378](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e73e24d1-ef8c-4931-af91-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#378](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e73e24d1-ef8c-4931-af91-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Minimize** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the hot state.
